main event: On 4th September 1956 in Vandalia, Ohio, a civilian reported sighting an object the size of a pea that appeared to stand still for 20 minutes and had the color to stand still.
interesting points: The sighting was reported to be caused by reflection, possibly of Mars in the southeast at 25 degrees elevation.
The report includes a U.S. Air Force Technical Information Sheet used to gather detailed information about the unidentified aerial phenomenon.
There were multiple forms and questionnaires used to record the details of the UFO sighting, such as weather conditions, the position of the observer, and the characteristics of the object.
Various factors such as the condition of the sky, the location of the sun, and the presence of stars and moon during the sighting were documented.
The witness was asked to estimate the size, speed, and distance of the object, as well as provide personal details and educational background.
photographs: No, the report did not include photographs
